content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is how you can solve this problem using regular expressions in Julia:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    blocks = split(md, "\n\n") # Split the markdown document into code blocks
    code_blocks = join([replace(strip(block), r"^```.*?```$" => "") for block in blocks if startswith(block, "```julia")], "\n") # Extract and remove code fences from each block
    return code_blocks
end
```

This function splits the markdown document into individual code blocks by searching for double newlines `\n\n`. Then it removes all code fences (defined as lines starting with ``` and ending with ```) using `replace` and `strip` functions. Finally, it joins all extracted code blocks together with a newline character.

Please note that this function assumes that the markdown document is correctly formatted and each julia code block starts with "```julia" and ends with "```". If this is not the case, you might want to add error checking or adjust the regular expression accordingly.
